dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: All you have to do is figure out who you're dealing with. And then play them at their level. Ramona bends down, puts her thumbs under Destiny’s thong, holds out the sides, stops. The man looks at them, desper He puts down another and another and another and another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: End of the night. Destiny counts out her tips, marveling the stack. She looks at the other girls, Jackie, Tracy, Justice, changing back into their plain clothes, talking. Destiny turns to Ramona lining her knee-high boots with c So Destiny does the same. She stuffs the bills, managing zip up one boot, can’t quite get the other. Ramona sees h  20.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Here... Ramona goes to help, shoving the cash further down Destin boot. Then holds her heel, leg in the air, while Destiny on the zipper. The two of them start laughing, then reall laugh, cracking up, together.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: She wasn't in it to make friends. It just happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chopin's Etude Op. 25 No. 9 in G-flat major. Fendi. Valentino. Balenciaga. Destiny and Ramona glide through t handbag section. Destiny poses with a gigantic Gucci bag.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Is it too big?

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? A bag can never be too big. C’mon, let’s ring you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SALESGIRL watches Ramona watch Destiny count out a thousand dollars on the counter. In ones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the window of another moving car, we see an ESCAL rolling through traffic, the sun glinting off of every cu Ramona’s hands on the wheel, Destiny in the passenger sea sunglasses on, talking, laughing, passing us by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s nice but not totally extravagant. Destiny stands in Ramona's WALK-IN CLOSET looking wide-eyed at all of Ramon things. Fur coats. A wall of heels.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh-kay... Destiny turns around to see Ramona presenting several HOMEMADE BATHING SUITS laid out on the bed.  21.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ta-da! I’m designing my own swim- line.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Wow. You made these? Destiny walks into the bedroom, looks at Ramona's creatio

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: I like to use a lotta mixed media, so...I find these leather pieces and I make little belts out of chains and these here are called epaulets? Which is French for little shoulders. A lot of people are scared to wear denim in the ocean but I swear these get more comfortable when they’re wet. Specifically saltwater. Try ‘em on. Destiny steps right into the denim bikini bottoms under h skirt. Ramona goes for a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s gonna take forever to save up the money to start a label. But one of my clients is a graphic designer and he made me this logo. Look at that. Swimona. It’s catchy right?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: «+. did you go to school for it?

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Yup. Only thirteen credits away from graduating... Oh my god those look so good on you. See? They look in the mirror together, like sisters. The sound the front door...

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bear cub, is that you? Ramona's daughter, JULIET (9) comes running into the room her school uniform, followed by her NANNY (50s). Ramona w her arms around Juliet, kissing her head over and over.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How’s my genius? How’s that great big brain of yours? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Juliet, this is Mommy’s friend Dorothy, can you say hi? ... She gets shy around anyone that’s not a cute boy.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: Mom... Ramona tickles Juliet. Juliet laughs. Destiny smiles at t

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Thank you, Manuela! I’1l take it from here.

dialogues.speaker: MANUELA
dialogues.text: Okay, good-night, Miss! Bye Juju! Manuela waves goodbye. Ramona looks at her daughter.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: What do you want for dinner?

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: Chicken fingers.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Chicken fingers? No, I’m gonna make you something better than that. Go on, get out of your school clothes. Juliet runs out. Ramona watches her go, beaming.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: She looks just like you.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Good, I like to think I made her myself.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: .-. it’s just the two of you?

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: And Manuela. I don’t know what I'd do without Manuela. INT. RAMONA’S APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM - LATER After dinner, Ramona and Destiny sit on the couch. Juliet asleep in Ramona’s lap. Ramona plays with her hair. Ramon and Destiny are talking quietly.  23.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: I just don’t ever want to be dependent on anyone. Like ever. I just want to be able to take care of my grandma for the rest of her life. And maybe go shopping once in awhile.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s how I feel. I just want my daughter to be able to do whatever she wants, you know? Go to whatever school she wants, or not, if that’s what she wants. I swear, I'd do anything for this kid. (then) Motherhood is a mental illness. Destiny looks at her. Half-laughs.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Well, that explains my mother.... Ramona looks at Destiny and pouts sympathetically...

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Is that how you'd describe her?

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK TO
dialogues.text: INT. DESTINY’S HOUSE - YEARS LATER We RETURN to the white living room, Destiny and the young woman on the opposite couch.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: My mother?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
dialogues.text: I mean, Ramona. Destiny glances down at a DIGITAL RECORDER on the table between them. Destiny’s jewelry makes noise.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: .-.- how much of this is going in the article? Cause I hope it’s not about all strippers being thieves or something.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
dialogues.text: Not at all...  24.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Cause they’re not. It’s things like this that add to the stigma. I don’t want to perpetuate anything.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
dialogues.text: Of course. Destiny looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: You gotta understand, I was making an honest living then. Everything was good. Everybody was making money. Sean Kingston’s “Beautiful Girls” takes us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny gives her grandmother a stack of cash.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I helped my grandma get out of debt... INT. DESTINY’S APARTMENT - DAY Ramona helps Destiny arrange her furniture. The place is small, but new, and all hers.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I got my own place in the city...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny sits at the bar, studying. The place is mostly em A few regulars. Some strippers on the floor with them.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ramona inspired me to go back to school.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Wow. Destiny looks over at STEPHEN (40s) eating wings.  25.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry. It’s just....your penmanship is really remarkable. She gives him a look, can’t help but laugh at him. He doe notice, face full of wing sauce. He slides down a stool.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you a student?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Oh, that’s great... What do you study?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Psychology...I really am a student.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Oh no I believe you.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: I’m just saying, a lot of girls here say they’re students but I really am getting my degree.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: And I think that’s great. Stephen.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Destiny.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Destiny. You’re very...exotic-— looking. I mean, I’m into Asian girls. It’s kinda my thing. She looks at him. The sound of a cash register ka-ching!

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: And what do you do, Stephen?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: I work at Lehman Brothers. I’m sorry I don’t mean to stare. I’m just...really blown away by your penmanship. Seriously, you could be a font. They can do that, you know. You can...they can make a font of your own handwriting. So you can put it on your computer.  26.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: I don’t have a computer.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Oh...

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Guess that’s why my handwriting’s so good. She smiles at him. He laughs, charmed, fish in a barrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny does homework on a BRAND NEW LAPTOP. Ramona walks kisses Destiny’s head, proud. Destiny smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: 2007 was the fucking best...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny and Ramona dance for TWO AGGRESSIVE BIG SHOTS (40

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I made more money that year than a goddamn brain surgeon. And sure, some days sucked, like any other job. But other days...

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: What do you think? Destiny sits in the driver’s seat, feeling the steering w in her hands, Ramona next to her.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. This is fucking it. We see the Escalade is parked on a SHOWROOM FLOOR. Ramona turns on the RADIO: It's Britney, bitch. “Gimme More”. They sing along to the song, dancing in their seats, maki the Escalade shake, the SALESMEN watching from a few feet away, wide-eyed. Britney continues over:

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: We INTERCUT the WALL STREET GUYS and the DANCERS...  27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys in their offices, hustling their clients...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the floor, Destiny, Ramona, Diamond, Mercedes, Justice Tracy, Star, and Jackie are all hustling the guys. The gu are making it rain. The girls are securing the bag. Stephen puts a diamond necklace around Destiny’s neck. Tracy gently talks down her BOYFRIEND. She kisses him and sends him on his way. Then gets back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diamond yells at one of the managers. He can’t get a word

dialogues.speaker: DIAMOND
dialogues.text: I’m telling you right now, Carmen, you fuck with my money, I’m gonna fuck with your whole life. You hear me? What the fuck do you do here anyway? I know what the bouncers and the waitresses and the DJ's doing, what the fuck do you do? (walking away, still shouting) Get the fucking stage fixed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny and Ramona are hanging out when A HANDSOME MAN (3 comes up to Destiny. Instant chemistry. This is JOHNNY. A Destiny and Johnny flirt, we PUSH in Ramona looking at th She's got a bad vibe about him... INT. DESTINY’S APARTMENT - NIGHT In the midst of Destiny and Ramona’s success, we also see Destiny and Johnny arguing with each other in the kitchen

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY DESTINY
dialogues.text: Who gave it to you?! Fuck off! We whip away from them and zoom in on the TV. KEEPING UP THE KARDASHIANS. PILOT EPISODE.  28.

dialogues.speaker: KIM KARDASHIAN, (TALKING HEAD)
dialogues.text: Welcome to my family. I’m Kim Kardashian. KIM ENTERS THEIR HUGE HOUSE WITH SHOPPING BAGS.

dialogues.speaker: KIM KARDASHIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The princess is in the building!

dialogues.speaker: QUICK FLASHES
dialogues.text: MONEY exchanging hands over and over...

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The last great night I remember...

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It was the night Usher came in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz screams to the other strippers.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Motherfuckin’ Usher’s here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER SLOW-MOTION. USHER comes in the club. We’re on the of his head as the sea of people part for him. The strippers are freaking out, screaming for him. The Wa Street guys are more-than-psyched to join his entourage.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They put his own music on... The DJ spins Usher. It feels like a fucking music video.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And all the girls lined up to dance for him... Usher slips into a seat at the end of the stage, a long r of gorgeous girls as far as anyone can see lines up to da for him, Destiny, Ramona, Justice, and Diamond among them The club at its peak.  29.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And for one last moment, everything was so glamorous and cool.

dialogues.speaker: SEPTEMBER 29, 2008.
dialogues.text: PUSH in on a SCREEN, BRIAN WILLIAMS talking to camera:

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: «+. we begin our story tonight with what’s been called the worst financial crisis in modern times, the largest financial disaster in decades in this country, and perhaps the end of an era in American business, some of the biggest names in American business are tonight gone, along with a lot of money and a lot of jobs... INT. DESTINY’S APARTMENT - DAY Destiny and Johnny sit on the bed reeling, the sound of B Williams on TV in the background.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The crash put everybody out of business. But I had other things on my mind. CLOSE on a PREGNANCY TEST in her hand. She starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: How am I gonna make money? Johnny pulls her into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: I’ll take care of you. On Destiny's face, realizing she’s dependent on him now.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: .+. I hope it’s a boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny pushes her cart around the wide aisles, her DAUGH (2) sitting in the front, holding a Barbie.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: After I stopped working, I lost touch with Ramona. It's just what happens when you have a kid. Destiny buys diapers in bulk. She browses the clothes. Th shoes. The handbags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny stands in a long line, watching the SALESGIRL (he age) ring up her bulk items. Each BEEP across the scanner like a knife in Destiny’s head. She looks around at the o MOMS pushing carts, wrangling their kids. BEEP. BEEP. BEE INT. DESTINY’S APARTMENT - NIGHT Destiny and Johnny are in the middle of a bad fight. She’ crying, storming after him. The baby is crying on the flo

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Good, go! We don’t need you! Johnny walks out the front door. Slamming it behind him. Destiny goes to her daughter, picks her up, rocks her.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shhhh, it’s okay. Mommy’s got you. PRE-LAP: a RINGING PHONE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen crosses his huge living room to answer his phone.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Stephen? It’s Destiny.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Destiny? Wow...it’s been a few years.  31.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah, time flies. It sounds like she’s been crying.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Where are you? We follow Stephen down a flight of stairs to the third le

dialogues.speaker: WITH
dialogues.text: INT. DESTINY’S APARTMENT —- SAME

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: I just got back to the city. I moved to Arizona for a few years but I didn’t really like it. I missed the seasons and...I missed you. The guys in Arizona are nothing like here... Her BABY makes noises next to her.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you still there?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Yeah, I -- Do you need to get that?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Do you need to help the baby?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: It’s my friend’s baby, I’m just watching it. Listen, I don’t mean to bother you. If you’re not happy to hear from me, I can call some--

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: No, I’m happy. I just... (lowering his voice) I wish you'd called sooner...Fatima came back.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Who?  32.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: My fiancee. I mean, my wife. My fiancee became my wife. Destiny’s face/voice immediately changes.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Right, well, that’s how it happens. Okay, bye Stephen. She hangs up. Destiny looks down at a hand-written list labeled GET MONEY. She crosses Stephen’s name off the bot of the list. Destiny looks at her baby, starting to panic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny sits at the make-up counter with a EUROPEAN WOMAN The woman looks at Destiny’s RESUME for a long time. Dest shifts in her seat, her jewelry making noise.

dialogues.speaker: INTERVIEWER
dialogues.text: ++. SO your last job was in 2008?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Yes. It’s not like I...I had a kid, so...I was busy doing that.

dialogues.speaker: INTERVIEWER
dialogues.text: A year of waitressing. Did you graduate high school? Oh, I see here, you got your GED. Five years at Privilege Gentleman's Club. What did you do there exactly?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Bartending. Mostly.

dialogues.speaker: INTERVIEWER
dialogues.text: --. and what about at...Moves?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Mostly bartending.

dialogues.speaker: INTERVIEWER
dialogues.text: «+. So you don’t have any retail experience?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Not yet. But...that’s why I’d really like to get experience...so that I would have it.  33.

dialogues.speaker: INTERVIEWER
dialogues.text: We're really looking for someone with retail experience.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: (laughing) Well, how am I supposed to get retail experience without retail experience? I mean, I sold...beer. What’s the difference?

dialogues.speaker: INTERVIEWER
dialogues.text: Maybe you should go back to bartending. Destiny stands up and starts out. Turns back.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Could I get that back? I only have one copy. The woman gives Destiny her resume. INT. DESTINY'S GRANDMOTHER’S HOUSE - LATER Destiny walks in to see her daughter sitting alone on the floor, Destiny’s GRANDMOTHER asleep in her chair, the TV Destiny goes to her daughter and picks her up, kissing he head. She carries her upstairs, whispering...

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: You tired? Did you get a nap? INT. DESTINY’S CHILDHOOD BEDROOM - MOMENTS LATER Destiny lays her daughter down in her old twin bed and cl in next to her, under the covers. Destiny looks up at the ceiling, her arm around her daughter. Slowly, the SOUNDS the club get louder and louder, until we inevitably CUT T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny sits in her old spot, putting on her make-up.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN STRIPPER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You're in my seat. She looks up at a RUSSIAN STRIPPER (20s).  34.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Oh. Sorry. Destiny moves out of her way. Taking the next seat. The Russian checks her hair in the mirror. She is model-flawl

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: «+. you’re so pretty. Just then, ANOTHER RUSSIAN STRIPPER (20s) steps up behind her. She’s just as beautiful. They speak Russian to each other, then walk away. Destiny looks around the room. The girls are all drop-dead. Not a familiar face in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny circulates the half-empty room. The mood is different. The club has changed. None of the old regulars longer fun or harmless. Destiny sees--

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Mom! Mom is working behind the bar, slinging Red Bulls.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Welcome back, sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: They got you out front now?

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Yup. Talent squandered. Mom tosses a can in the trash.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: 2008 happened. The guys don’t wanna spend money. The girls don’t wanna share tips. The busboys are finding more cash in the couch cushions. The managers took the cameras outta the champagne room, so nobody’s looking out. And I’m stuck in customer service... (turning to a customer) Yes, I see you, hello. Another Red Bull? Destiny looks around the room.  35.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Who are these girls?

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Russians, mostly.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: They look like models.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: They're giving blow jobs for three hundred dollars a pop. Mom slides away. Destiny scans the room, knowing she can’ compete, knowing she can’t work it alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny dances for an aggressive STOCK BROKER (40s).

dialogues.speaker: STOCK BROKER
dialogues.text: Yeah, what else you got? C’mon don’t be a tease. Are you a tease? Feel how hard you make me. Destiny looks where the cameras used to be.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: ...we’re not supposed to...

dialogues.speaker: STOCK BROKER
dialogues.text: C’mon just stroke it. I’1l give you a hundred. A hundred? One hundred? Destiny deliberates. He sees her consideration and pulls his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: STOCK BROKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah. Stroke it. Come on. He puts three bills on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: STOCK BROKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here. Three hundred. Please? Just for a minute. Come on... He pulls out a small vile of cocaine.

dialogues.speaker: STOCK BROKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We’ll make each other feel good. He taps a bump of coke on his hand, snorts it. Then taps another. Puts it in front of her. She reluctantly leans i  36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny sits on the toilet seat, crying. Then takes off h heels and rubs her sore foot, wincing from the pain. She her bare feet flat on the bathroom floor.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: When I got off the floor, I saw he gave me three twenties.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. DESTINY’S HOUSE - DAY [YEARS LATER] Destiny looks away, her eyes welling at the thought. Elizabeth looks at her, pained for her. Destiny wipes a t

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: You don’t need to believe me. I’m used to people not believing me. I’m only telling you so you understand where my head was at when I saw her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny walks out of the bathroom, still shaken. Flo Rida “Club Can’t Handle Me” is playing too loud. Destiny looks around, lost, when she catches sight of a familiar face - EVERYTHING SLOWS -- Ramona. Button-down shirt, pencil ski She’s now rolling with Mercedes and a PETITE GIRL (18). T three of them corral a SHIT-FACED GUY toward the Champagn Room. Ramona spots Destiny. They lock eyes. Like long lost sist with a secret. Ramona takes a few steps in Destiny’s direction. Destiny does the same. They cross the room to other, meet in the middle, face-to-face. Ramona smiles an holds out her arms. Destiny practically collapses into th

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Whoa... Ramona holds her up, Destiny burrows into Ramona. They embrace in the middle of the room, swaying back and forth  37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny and Ramona sit in a booth across from each other. Ramona is looking at pictures on Destiny’s phone.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Oh my god she’s gorgeous, of course. How old is she?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Two-and-a-half. Destiny takes her phone back. Ramona looks at her, smilin

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: There’s nothing like it, is there? Juliet still lets me sleep in her bed but I just know she’s gonna kick me out any day. They look at each other, bursting with years of stories.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I missed you, you know.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: I missed you, too.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Where’d you go baby? Destiny shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What happened with Johnny? They hold hands across the table. Sending messages.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you call me? You and Lily can always stay with me and Juju. You know that. Destiny goes to pull her hands away but Ramona holds on.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C’mon don’t do that thing. It’s me. Destiny looks up at her.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: I’m so tired. It’s exhausting...  38. Ramona smiles. Destiny tries to but tears fall from her e She quickly wipes them away.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Hey. Remember what we were like back then? Remember? We were fucking hurricanes, weren't we?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: I just need to make money. I need to be independent. Me and Lily. Ramona looks at Destiny. Squeezes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: She told me what happened after the crash...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramona looks around the room. The place is almost complet empty. The few patrons are crying on the girls’ shoulders

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls are all crying on each other’s shoulders. For t first time, Ramona looks very worried. She takes out her iPhone and calls Destiny. But Destiny doesn’t answer.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: With half of Wall Street unemployed, Ramona wasn't far behind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramona's working retail, folding clothes at the back of t store with Mercedes.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Mercedes got her a job in fashion.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: «+. I can’t believe he got arrested. Like now what am I supposed to do? How am I supposed to pay for lawyers when I can’t even afford his half of the rent? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s like...enough to make me call off the wedding.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Well? Listen, Mercedes...and you know I love Dragon...but do you really wanna marry someone who’s probably going to prison?

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I mean...three-to- five is a big commitment. A RESERVED WOMAN (50s) comes out of the dressing room.

dialogues.speaker: RESERVED WOMAN
dialogues.text: I can’t get the zipper.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Let me help you, dear. Ramona goes to help the woman. Zips her up.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wow this looks so good on you. And who doesn’t love khaki, am I right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramona takes a breath and knocks on the half-open door.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Hey...Mark? The MANAGER (20s) looks up from his sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, I was hoping you wouldn’t mind if I ducked out early on Fridays so I could pick up my daughter at school? She has half days for the rest of the year...

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: (mouth full) Rest of the year? No.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Rest of the school year. It takes him too long to finish a bite and swallow.  40.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: .-. well, what if I could find someone to switch shifts with? Mercedes said she’d-- He sighs, rolling his head around.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: It took me forever to figure out everyone’s stupid schedules...

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: I know, Mark. I just...I wouldn't ask if it wasn’t for my kid, she’s...at a difficult age and, well, lately she’s been having a hard time at her new school--

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Am I the father? Ramona stops, confused. He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Am I the father? She looks at him. Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Then why would I give a shit? He gets back to his sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t you have a babysitter or a nanny or something? Ramona shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: I can’t afford that.  41.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Well, maybe if you put in more hours instead of racing out all the time...Craig’s got two kids, you don’t see him rushing home every time someone gets a nosebleed... His voice is drowned out by Kelly Rowland’s “Motivation”, we PUSH IN on Ramona's face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramona is back at it, dancing alongside TWO GIRLS (20s) f pair of COOL GUYS (20s, dressed down). They’re paying muc more attention (money) to the other girls. Ramona sees one of the guys gesture at her, then lean ove and whisper something to his boy. His boy calls Ramona ov She dances up to them. One of them pulls out a twenty.

dialogues.speaker: COOL GUY
dialogues.text: Hey, why don’t you take a break? No offense, we’re just not feeling ya. She looks at them. Takes the twenty and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramona walks off the floor and into the dressing room whe she sees a small girl sitting on the floor, crying.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: What’s wrong, baby? ANNABELLE (18, the petite girl we saw Ramona rolling with looks up at her with big eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annabelle watches Ramona use a tiny pair of scissors to c the string off a tampon.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: There...we...go. You’re gonna have to reach in there to get it out. Annabelle smiles, grateful.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: How d’you learn to do that?  42.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Oh, some...old...... (trails off, half-laughs) Don’t you have sisters? Annabelle shakes her head, starts crying again.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: My brothers don’t talk to me anymore. I told my mom and dad I worked here and they kicked me out of the house. Ramona looks at Annabelle’s innocent face, plays with her hair.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: «+. you wanna go fishing? Annabelle looks at Ramona, that infectious smile.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What's fishing? The sound of the NYSE CLOSING BELL takes us to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys in suits pour out of their offices...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And into the bars. We PAN OVER to find Ramona, Mercedes a Annabelle seated at one of the outdoor bars, sizing them

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Since the recession, the clubs need customers. So all we gotta do is reel ‘em in... INT. FINANCIAL DISTRICT BAR —- LATER Among the happy-hour crowd, we find Mercedes sitting in a form-fitting dress at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Anyone can own one nice suit. You wanna look at their shoes, their watches, briefcases... Mercedes makes eye contact with a BUSINESSMAN.  43.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Their wedding rings. Always look for a wedding ring. His wedding ring glints in her eye. Mercedes goes in. INT. FINANCIAL DISTRICT BAR —- LATER Mercedes sits with the married businessman. They clink glasses. She touches his upper thigh. He looks down, psyc

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Once you got ‘em on the hook, that's when we get the net. Just then, Annabelle and Ramona roll up to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Spencer, these are my co-workers! The girls all surround Spencer, touching him, passing aro shots, pretending to drink them, passing around coke, pretending to sniff it. Spencer really does the shots. Spencer really sniffs the coke.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Let’s go to a club!

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Let’s go to a strip club!

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Oh I don’t know... Annabelle rubs Spencer’s arm. Mercedes touches his leg.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: C’mon! We’re all gonna be at our desks at 9am regretting the moment we could've gone to a strip club together and didn’t...let’s do it!

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: I’m in! INT. RAMONA’S ESCALADE - LATER They all pile in, Ramona behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Then we steer him to the club...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls escort Spencer through the front door.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: .--where we've negotiated ourselves a percentage of his spending... The MANAGER gives them a nod.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: .--and then we run up his credit card as far as we can push it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercedes holds up an empty vodka bottle.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Another round? Spencer hands over his credit card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom swipes his credit card through the machine.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Shots! All the girls hold their shot glasses in the air. Spencer too, though he clearly doesn’t need it. He slams his. The pretend to slam theirs. Someone puts the bill in front of him, puts the pen in his hand. He signs without looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls fold Spencer into the back of a cab.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Okay, Spencer, tell the nice man where you live.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: N’York.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Little more specific.  45.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: Fith Avenue.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Close enough. Ramona shuts the door. The cab pulls away. The girls can’ help but crack up, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But going fishing doesn’t mean you catch a marlin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annabelle sits in a form-fitting dress at the bar, sizing a GOOD-LOOKING GUY in a nice suit. He turns, smiles at he She looks down at his shitty shoes. She sighs and turns a

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: «+. and some of these guys didn't want to party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls try the same thing on a STRAIGHT-LACED MAN (40s Mercedes holds up shots. He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: STRAIGHT-LACED MAN
dialogues.text: Oh no. No thank you. Mercedes and Annabelle look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls try again on a MAN IN GLASSES (30s).

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN GLASSES
dialogues.text: Oh I can’t, but...this was fun. He slips out, leaving the three girls alone. Another wast a night. The bartender hands Ramona the bill.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Fffuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramona, Mercedes and Annabelle sit together, defeated.  46.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: ... what do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: I’m supposed to meet a new lawyer for Dragon. I can’t fucking afford him now. Annabelle starts crying.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I can’t move back home.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Guess it’s back to the pole. Ramona looks at them, the wheels turning.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That's when Ramona came up with her special recipe. INT. RAMONA’S ESCALADE - ANOTHER NIGHT Parked outside of the bar. Ramona shows Annabelle and Mercedes a vile of powder. They look at her wide-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: It’s barely any different than what we're doing now. It’s a short-cut. A sure thing.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: What if someone gets hurt?

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Nobody’1l get hurt. At worst, they’1l have a bad hangover.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: What if they go to the cops?

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: And say what? I just spent five grand at a strip club? Send help? They won’t know what happened til they look at their bank account. Annabelle exhales.  47.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I think I’m gonna throw up.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: We're not the only ones doing this. How do you think the clubs stay in business? Post-2008. It’s a side hustle. Everybody’s had to get creative.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: .+. I know a girl from Queens who did this.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Did she get caught?

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Nah. She sent her two kids to college. Now she lives in Miami. Started her own nail salon. The girls look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: So what do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny looks at Ramona, wide-eyed with all the informati

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Ketamine and MDMA. The Ketamine wipes their memory and the MDMA makes them happy.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: How many times have you done it?

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Three. Including tonight. (then) We made five grand. Split three ways. Destiny exhales.  48.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Could make it four. (then) It'd be like old times. Ramona pushes back Destiny’s hair. Destiny’s head is spinning. Ramona leans in.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We gotta start thinking like these Wall Street guys. I mean, look what they did to this country. They stole from everybody. Hard-working people lost everything. And not a single one of these guys went to jail. Is that fair? They’re coming in the club with stolen money. That’s who’s paying for the blow jobs. The fucking firefighter retirement fund. Fuck these guys. A WAITRESS comes over and pours more coffee. Destiny look her. She walks away. Destiny watches the waitress work.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We can’t dance forever. You want to go back to minimum wage? (then) The game is rigged. And it doesn’t reward the people who play by the rules. You can either stand in the corner or get in the ring. Destiny’s wheels are turning. She looks up at Ramona.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: I don’t want to hurt anybody. I’m not out for revenge.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Me either. They would do this anyway. It’s like robbing a bank. Except they’re giving us the keys. Nobody gets hurt. Ramona looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: «+. SO are you in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercedes sits close with a SHORT GUY (30s, tailored suit.

dialogues.speaker: SHORT GUY
dialogues.text: Well it’s getting late....

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Oh I guess it is. That’s a shame... She crosses her legs. He tries to look up her skirt.

dialogues.speaker: SHORT GUY
dialogues.text: What about you? You gotta get up early tomorrow? Or....

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Mmmmm...let’s have one more. She flags down the bartender for one more round. Just the Annabelle, Destiny and Ramona join them.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, these are my sisters! The girls surround him, making introductions, touching hi all over, hands everywhere. Ramona gets them all drinks, giving the bartender a huuuge tip. She reaches in her bag Mercedes gets the short guy’s attention, distracting him while Ramona goes for his drink. The guy turns, about to when Annabelle steps in front of him, blocking his view w her angelic face. Destiny goes to rub his shoulders. Ramo takes a tiny vile out of her bag and taps it against his glass. The powder drops in his drink. Just a sprinkle.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: To sisters!

dialogues.speaker: GIRLS
dialogues.text: To sisters!

dialogues.speaker: SHORT GUY
dialogues.text: To sisters! He toasts them. Destiny watches him down his drink.

dialogues.speaker: FOUR PAIRS OF HEELS WALKING WITH A MAN'S SHINY S
dialogues.text: LEVITATING AN INCH OFF THE GROUND. The girls carry the sh guy, half-conscious toward the --  50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramona shuts the curtain behind them. The girls drop the on the couch. He bounces off the couch onto the floor. Annabelle grabs a bucket of champagne and throws up in it

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Help her.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: You okay? Mercedes goes to help Annabelle. Destiny and Ramona drag guy back up on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Does this always happen?

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Was it too much?

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: I don’t know...you alright, Gary? Gary smiles and drools.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can you open your eyes, Gary? Gary opens one eye.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s that, Gary? Another round? Gary won’t budge.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: ++. what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Wait! Ramona points. Destiny looks. Gary is ever-so-slowly reac for his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's it, Gary...  51. He creeps out his wallet, fumbling with his credit cards.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Which one is it, Gary, this one? He nods yes. Ramona takes it and starts out. We follow he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramona strides up to the bar, hands the card to Mom, then looks at the dancers hard at work. The CREDIT CARD swipes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHAMPAGNE POPS! CLOSE on Destiny’s face, flush with adrenaline. She dances on the couch with Ramona and Merce passing around the champagne bottle, music playing. Annab is seated, a little queasy, but happy. They’re all laughi

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: ... no, the worst guys are the ones that put condoms on in the bathroom ahead of time. Then you know you gotta grind it out. Mercedes steps over Annabelle, gives her a lap-dance. Annabelle laughs.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: We don’t have to go back, do we?

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Our dancing days are over. Annabelle smiles. Destiny smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: I can pay off my grandmother’s house. Mercedes fans herself with a splay of money.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: I think I’m gonna get myself an engagement ring. Dragon can sit in jail a few more weeks. They all laugh. Ramona holds up the champagne bottle.  52.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: To Gary!

dialogues.speaker: GIRLS
dialogues.text: To Gary! They lift Annabelle to her feet. The four of them dance.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mom? They turn to see Juliet in her pajamas. Ramona goes to he

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Oh baby I’m sorry, did we wake you? Ramona takes Juliet’s hands and starts to dance with her. Juliet can’t help but laugh, sleepy. Ramona picks her up carries her over to the other girls. Mercedes and Annabel are dancing on either side of Destiny.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: You guys really are my sisters. Annabelle gives Destiny a “big sis” kiss on the cheek. Destiny beams, wrapping her arms around her “little sis”. Mercedes wraps her arms around both of them. Ramona hugs all.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: That's right. We’re a family now. A family with moneyyyyyy! The girls howl. Destiny smiles, part of the family.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Okay I know it sounds bad to say we were, like, drugging people...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. DESTINY’S HOUSE - KITCHEN - PRESENT The young woman looks at Destiny, wide-eyed, recorder in hand.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: .-- but in our world, it was like, normal. Half of these guys were mainlining coke on the way to work. But still, we needed to make it as safe as possible. So I suggested we tweak the recipe...  53. Destiny turns on the stove. Puts on a teapot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramona and Destiny stand at the counter.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: What do you think, 60/40?

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: 60/40 what?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: 60 MDMA, 40 ketamine?

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: «+. that sounds right. Ingredients on the counter. Pills of MDMA. Viles of liqui

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Do we turn the powder into a liquid or turn the liquid into a powder? Ramona thinks. Tapping her nails. Chopin’s Etude Op. 10 N in C-sharp minor. CLOSE ON THE PILLS BEING CRUSHED WITH A PESTLE... CLOSE ON THE BURNER ON HIGH... WATER BOILING... Ramona ties on an apron. Puts a plate on top of the pot o boiling water. Sets the flame low. Destiny pours the ketamine into the plate, Ramona watchin like mother and daughter baking a cake. The liquid slowly evaporates. Ramona stirs. Destiny refills the pan until o a powder remains. They mix the two powders together. Destiny and Ramona each sample a tiny amount.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: They are asleep on the floor. Ramona slowly wakes up. She leans over and wakes up Destiny. They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Let’s try it in the oven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The liquid ketamine bakes in a glass pan. Ramona opens th oven, wearing oven mitts, and pulls out the glass pan. Sh sets the pan on top of the stove to cool. Destiny looks a the crystals, in awe.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Just a sprinkle. INT. RAMONA’S APARTMENT - KITCHEN - LATER Ramona and Destiny clean up after themselves.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: I’m still not sure about strangers.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: But that’s the beauty of ‘em. They're strangers.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: I don’t want to slip it to anybody who's not already on something. We gotta know these guys like to party. And that they have money to lose. Enough to not care if some is missing. With strangers, it’s unpredictable, there’s no guarantee. Ramona nods in agreement. She starts to smile. DESTINY (V.O.)(CONT’D) (CONT'D) So we called up some old friends. INT. RAMONA’S APARTMENT - NIGHT CLOSE on Ramona's phone as she scrolls through her contacts... Dev Bear Stearns, Eddie Goldman Sachs, David Morgan Stanley... She picks one. Like cold-calling. Mercedes and Destiny watch Ramona at work, Annabelle in t background, playing with Juliet and Lily.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: David, is that you? It’s Ramona. or) Well I definitely remember you and I’m sure you remember me because nobody ever forgets meeting me. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Why gon’? I send you a picture and jog your memory? RAMONA TAKES A PHOTO OF ANNABELLE. RAMONA ATTACHES THE PHOTO TO A TEXT: Hit me up xx. SEND. Almost immediately, Ramona’s phone BUZZES with a response

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annabelle sits too close to DAVID (40s). (We remember him the WALL STREET GUY from the club. Mr. Lucy Liu.) Just th Mercedes, Ramona, and Destiny roll up to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: David, these are my friends!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A parade of familiar faces, assholes we met before 2008..

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: These are my sisters! The girls surround Guy #2, touching, distracting Guy #3, handing a drink to Guy #4, Guy #5 takes a sip... CLOSE on the powder dissolving in their drinks... CLOSE on their hands clinking glasses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pile Guy #6 into Ramona’s Escalade...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They corral Guy #7 into the club...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. RAMONA’S APARTMENT - VARIOUS The girls pop champagne, celebrating. INT. DESTINY’S GRANDMOTHER’S HOUSE - DAY Destiny gives her grandmother a giant stack of money and kiss on the cheek. Her grandmother beams, so proud. INT. RAMONA’S APARTMENT - DAY Ramona helps her daughter with her homework, as Manuela cleans up after dinner. Ramona smiles, grateful she’s bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercedes shakes hands with a HIGH-POWERED LAWYER for Drag INT. ANNABELLE’S BROOKLYN APARTMENT - DAY Annabelle rearranges furniture in her own place. She sits her couch with her CAT, looks around, happy, independent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four girls try on shoes. Destiny watches Ramona on on her many cell phones.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Maybe one of ‘em would call and complain but we could handle it...

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? You had a great time. You were so happy you kept tipping everybody, remember?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ramona could always handle it...

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do? Call the police? Are you really gonna tell your wife and the police what you did? Does that sound worth whatever amount you think you're missing? You went out, you had an epic night, it cost money, why should it cost you any more than that?  57.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We treated it like a business... INT. RAMONA’S APARTMENT - DAY Destiny and Ramona sit at the kitchen table surrounded in paperwork, their daughters play together in the backgroun

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: .«.. SO Annabelle’1ll meet JP Morgan and Mercedes’11 meet Wells Fargo.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Mercedes met Wells Fargo last time.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: How much did we charge last time?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: ... five thousand on his American Express and two thousand on his corporate card.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Does he have any airline miles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annabelle and Mercedes try on expensive dresses.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We branched out, cultivated a certain level of clientele...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annabelle sits next to a HANDSY MAN (40s).

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: An architect. Whoa. No wonder you got such nice hands.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: .-.- but the bigger the fish, the bigger the bait had to be. The architect bites her neck. She tries to stay playful.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHITECT
dialogues.text: Let’s fuck in the bathroom.  58.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Owwwhhh...hang on...my sisters should be here any minute... Annabelle tries to keep his hands at bay...

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So that's when I said...I mean, that’s when we realized...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parked. Destiny turns to Ramona in the driver’s seat. Destiny’s lips move, BUT WE HEAR...

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We need to be outsourcing. Ramona nods and responds, lips moving, BUT WE HEAR...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. DESTINY’S HOUSE - KITCHEN - DAY Destiny hands the young woman a cup of tea.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: So we put an ad in Craigslist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ONE SHOT: FOUR RECRUITS (20-39) sit with trays from the various vendors. The girls are sore thumbs, even at the m Mom stands in front of them, clipboard in hand. Destiny stands behind her, taking mental notes.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Okay, lovelies. Does anyone have any allergies? Anything life- threatening? GEORGIA (20) speaks up first.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIA
dialogues.text: I got asthma. Next to her, CRYSTAL (20s).  59.

dialogues.speaker: CRYSTAL
dialogues.text: I don’t like feet.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: You have a foot allergy?

dialogues.speaker: CRYSTAL
dialogues.text: I’m just saying if a foot goes near my face, I will shut down. TRIXIE (30s) raises her hand.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: I don’t mind feet.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Great, you two’ll work together. Trixie and Crystal wave at each other.

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, now everybody find a partner and let’s work on our fake-drinking and sniffing. Destiny looks up to see Ramona and a STRUNG-OUT BLONDE (3 walking over. She joins the group with a plate of noodles Ramona joins Destiny, beverage in hand.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: They have an Orange Julius. Ramona holds out her Julius. Destiny takes a sip of it.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: What’s Coco doing here? We said no junkies, no criminals.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: So she’s a junkie and a criminal.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: People change... They look at Coco practicing a real sniff of cocaine.  60.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fine, but I promised her lunch. (turns, gasps) And who's this?? Ramona runs over to ANGEL (30), a TINY DOG in her purse.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: This is Mr. Bruce. Destiny watches Ramona takes the little dog in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I take him with me everywhere, I hope that’s not a problem.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Not at all. Mom tries to wrangle everybody back on course.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Okay, angels, eyes up here, now let's work on our etiquette. Does everybody have a fork? The girls all hold up their plastic forks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls flood the department store, browsing the racks nicer clothes, trying on make-up, sampling perfume. The o SHOPPERS look on. The SALESGIRLS are shocked. Ramona hold a dress. Destiny holds up a credit card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parked. Ramona behind the wheel, Destiny beside her. They turn to see Mercedes and Georgia in back, Herve Leger dresses...

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: No drinking. No drugs.

dialogues.speaker: WITH
dialogues.text: Annabelle and Angel (and Mr. Bruce) in the back-seat...

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Once you get the signature, you can party your head out.  61.

dialogues.speaker: WITH
dialogues.text: Crystal and Trixie in the back-seat. Ramona hands over a of powder. Crystal takes it... Annabelle takes the vile... Mercedes takes the vile. CUE: Scott Walker’s “Next”...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Georgia and Trixie dance for the Stockbroker who gave Des three twenties. Just when they think he’s gonna pass out, rises to his feet and dances with them. The girls look at each other. Georgia uses her inhaler. Angel and Annabelle dance for the Alpha, waiting for him pass out. When he finally does, they play with Mr. Bruce. Crystal and Mercedes are whispering in the Corporate Raid ear. He looks like a baby in their arms.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: What’s your mother’s maiden name?

dialogues.speaker: CRYSTAL
dialogues.text: And what are the last four digits of your social? We JUMP CUT from night to night, as each of the guys begi to lose consciousness...Crystal and Trixie keep going wit the dancing stockbroker until... he slowly falls like a t through the glass table and SMASHES through it. The table shatters into pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parked. Destiny is on the phone, card in hand.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: 6-6-1-0. And what’s my balance? Ramona looks at Destiny, proud.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I could do all the math in my head.  62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bouncers hold the doors open for Destiny and Ramona a they walk in like pimps, with their girls in formation.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Like if you told me the bill was 40 grand, I knew everybody's cut. All the employees smile and nod at them, as the girls mak their way through the room.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There were nights and weekends when we brought 100 grand into the club. And everybody got in on the action. SUPER: Moves Gentleman’s Club declined to comment.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The hosts. The managers. The DJ. This is during the recession, mind you. Without me making the effort to go out and market and promote, they wouldn't have a business. We weren't just some disposable dancers anymore. I was CFO of my own fucking corporation. Destiny looks around, standing tall.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: MOVING MEN. As far as the eye can see, lugging heavy furniture, couches, bed frames, boxes labeled FUR. SHOES. FEW SWEATING MEN emerge from the truck carrying a TANNING BED. We follow the tanning bed, as they carry it into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny and Ramona watch the men drag everything inside a up the stairs. Ramona gestures at the living room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramona and Destiny sit around the Christmas tree with the daughters and employees, Mom, Annabelle and Mercedes, and Manuela and her two daughters, all opening gifts. Destiny grandmother among them. Full house. Destiny’s grandmother opens a blue jewelry box and gasps.  63. DESTINY’S GRANDMOTHER Oh, Dorothy. What have you done?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: You always said you wanted real pearls. Destiny puts the necklace on her grandmother. DESTINY’S GRANDMOTHER Did you go to the bottom of the ocean for these?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Something like that. Destiny’s daughter LILY (now 4) unwraps a Barbie dreamhou

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Mommy it’s the one I wanted!

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Say thank you to your Aunt Ramona.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Thank you Auntie Mona.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Of course, Lily girl. Lily gives Ramona a hug. Mercedes opens a box of Loubouti and screams. Destiny and Ramona look at each other, proud Ramona unwraps a GUCCI PURSE.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my god, it’s enormous!

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Do you like it?

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: No...I love it. I’m gonna carry all my other bags in it. Ramona gives Destiny a kiss. Then, hands her a big box.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your turn. Destiny unties the red ribbon. Opens the box lid. Gasps.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: What was it?  64.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Chinchilla. Destiny pulls out a long fur coat. She tries it on. Runni her hands all over it. She smiles at Ramona, marveling.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m so proud of you, Dorothy. Destiny stops. Like she’s needed to hear that her whole l

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We don’t need anybody else, do we? Destiny shakes her head, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Nobody. Ramona throws an arm around Destiny.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: We’re the untouchables. Like Kobe and Shaq.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Who’s Kobe?

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: I’m Kobe and your Shaq.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Why do you get to be Kobe? They wrestle into a hug, laughing, making each other laug harder.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Okay, everybody get together! Mom takes a picture of everyone on her new iPhone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chopin's Etude Op. 10 No. 3 in E major. There’s an enormo spread. Ramona sits next to Destiny’s grandmother, Destin across from them, everyone’s heads bowed in prayer.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: .».. and thank you God for all that you have given us... (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: this delicious food, my new Louboutins, and especially for this family, my sisters, we are so blessed. Amen.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: Amen. They eat family-style, hands passing plates, everyone enjoying each other’s company. Destiny looks around, ever seat filled. She smiles, surrounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: End of the meal. Annabelle clears the table. Ramona is holding court, mid-story. Everyone’s listening, captivate

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: «+. so my friend brings me over to his table and introduces us and, you know, I don’t usually get nervous around these types, but suddenly he’s in front of me and... (to Destiny's grandmother) ++. do you know who he is, Nana? Do you get UsWeekly?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: She knows. She’s seen him. You've seen him, Nan. From the movies. DESTINY’S GRANDMOTHER I seen him. He’s very good-looking.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Well, listen, Nan, he’s even better looking in person... Ramona takes Destiny’s grandmother’s hand. Destiny clocks

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: +. so he picks me up in this white Porsche. And all he had told me was to wear a hat...

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: The Kentucky Derby.  66.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: ... that’s what I thought... But suddenly we’re at the airport and we're boarding this private jet to Monaco, and there was champagne and lobster and a butler and...I didn’t have the heart to tell him that I hate flying. So there I was, in this gorgeous marble bathroom... (laughing) .-. ten thousand feet in the air, vomiting champagne and lobster... (calling out) «+. Bella, come here, you'll like this story... (to Nan) ... Annabelle can throw up on command. It’s one of her many gifts... (to Annabelle) «+. come here, baby... Annabelle comes over to Ramona, laughing. Ramona puts Annabelle on her lap, bouncing her like a kid, continuing

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ... well, eventually the plane landed and, well, we had three of the most magnificent hours before the paparazzi caught up with us. And I’m afraid that’s the end of the PG-13 version. Everyone sighs with laughter, wishing the story wouldn't Destiny’s grandmother slowly leans over to Ramona. DESTINY’S GRANDMOTHER I once danced with Frankie Valli... Ramona bursts, grabbing Destiny’s grandma’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: WHAT
dialogues.text: Everyone bursts with her. Ramona turns to Destiny.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you know this? Destiny shakes her head, smiling, but... DESTINY’S GRANDMOTHER It was before he was married. The second time.  67.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Oh I don’t know, Nan, you sure about that? DESTINY’S GRANDMOTHER «+. pretty sure. Everyone howls, laughing. Ramona screams, stomps her feet

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: This woman is my spirit animal!

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA PUTS FRANKIE VALLI ON THE IPOD. CUE
dialogues.text: Everyone is dancing in the middle of the living room. Ram dances with Destiny’s grandmother, like old friends. Dest dances with the others, watching the two of them, smiling

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (shouting over the music) .-. tell the truth, Nan. If Frankie Valli had shown up on your wedding day and said “it’s me or your husband” what would you have said? Her grandmother takes an elderly beat. Then: DESTINY’S GRANDMOTHER “Which car you driving?” Ramona throws her head back and screams, then finds Desti face across the room.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: How have we not met sooner?? Destiny and Ramona smile at each other. Ramona turns back Destiny’s grandmother and dips her. Grandma laughs.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So...whose idea was it to start drugging them? Destiny stops smiling.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. DESTINY’S HOUSE - DAY Destiny looks at the young woman interviewing her.  68.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Is that what you’re hung up on?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
dialogues.text: -.. it’s hard not to be. Destiny looks at the recorder.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: What’s your name again?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
dialogues.text: Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Did you grow up with money, Elizabeth?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: We were...comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Right. What’d your parents do?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: My dad was a journalist. And my mom's a psychiatrist.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Where’d you go to school?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Brown. For undergrad.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: What would you do for a thousand dollars? Of course the answer depends on what you already have and what you need.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: So the drugging was Ramona’s idea?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: You know, I don’t think I should talk to you anymore. I’m sorry. I don’t know you and...these girls are like my sisters. I’m sorry. Destiny reaches for the recorder...

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: It’s okay, I understand...Ramona said the same thing.  69. Destiny stops. She looks up at Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: You talked to Ramona already?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH DESTINY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: «+. yeah. When?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: I went to her work.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Pfff.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Nothing. Just...the idea of Ramona Vega going straight. It’s like....a vampire doing.... Destiny trails off. She can just picture the two of them.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH TO
dialogues.text: INT. RAMONA’S OFFICE RAMONA AND ELIZABETH TALKING TO EACH OTHER ACROSS RAMONA’ DESK. WE CAN’T HEAR WHAT THEY’RE SAYING. IT’S TORTURE.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: So if you talked to her already, what do you need me for?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: I was hoping you could...fill in any blanks. Destiny clenches her jaw. Seeing red.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Blanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. RAMONA’S OFFICE

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA SAYS SOMETHING THAT MAKES ELIZABETH LAUGH. ELIZABE
dialogues.text: WRITES SOMETHING DOWN. CAN’T SEE IT. CAN’T HEAR IT.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: Destiny shifts in her seat. Her jewelry making noise.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Hmmmm... where was I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramona and Destiny pull up in front of Moves to see a TEA BLONDES leading a DAZED MAN out of their SUV.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Copycats. Ramona turns to Destiny...

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t think we need ‘em anymore. WE SEE ELIZABETH IN THE PASSENGER SEAT. IN DESTINY’S PLAC

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: The clubs. Ramona plays with Elizabeth's hair.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why should we have to split anything when we can have it all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: February, 2013. Ramona sits behind the wheel, her face li an iPad, Destiny beside her, looking out the passenger window, anxious. They are parked outside of an UPSCALE HO They're both in fur coats.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: I think I’m gonna buy these.  71. Destiny looks at Ramona. She’s zooming in on a pair of Gu shoes. Destiny turns back out the window.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: What’s taking her so long?

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Relax, she’s a pro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAWN (20s) comes teetering out of a room in her heels, talking to herself. She hurries down the hall.
She tries not to get distracted by the apartment numbers she makes her way to the elevator. Hard to tell if she’s or on drugs. She presses down. The door opens. She steps

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at the numbers. Tries not to get distracted.
A WOMAN (60s) gets in the elevator, on her cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN ON CELL
dialogues.text: We could meet at 5 or 6... No, 6 is good... You want 5? Dawn plugs her ears, mumbling. The doors close.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: I’m gonna fucking buy these. Ramona swipes her finger across the screen. Destiny looks her. We PUSH in on Destiny’s face... and hear a DING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator opens. Dawn hurries away from the woman...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dawn runs up to Destiny’s window, credit card in hand.
Dawn is obviously dumb and on drugs. Destiny gives her a furious look. Pulls out her cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramona paces. Destiny sits at the table, bouncing her leg

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Where the fuck are they?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Annabelle’s feeling grossed out lately.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: And what about Mercedes? Is she feeling grossed out? We can’t keep giving them their cut if they’re gonna disappear for weeks on end. We need a bigger crew. (pulling out phone) I’m calling Coco.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: No. She’s a cokehead.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: What about Crystal?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: She just got out of jail.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Trixie?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: She’s still in jail. Ramona. Quit...bringing home strays. We’re breaking the law here! We don’t want to work with criminals!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. DESTINY’S HOUSE - THE INTERVIEW Destiny explains her logic to Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: It’s like if we're a team and we’re making money and winning games, are you gonna suddenly start trading players and bringing in new people? But did she listen?

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: INT. RAMONA’S NEW APARTMENT - NIGHT Destiny walks in to see Ramona with her arm around Dawn.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Dorothy, this is Dawn. Destiny takes one look at DAWN and hates her rotten guts.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: Hiiiiiii. CUE: The Four Seasons’ “Dawn (Go Away)” begins to play in Destiny’s head. It continues over...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: The girls are all getting ready together for the night ou Destiny looks across the room at Ramona playing with Dawn hair. We PUSH in on them. We PUSH in on Destiny.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: As soon as I saw her I said, please, you’re gorgeous, you must join us. And she said... Tell ‘em what you said, Dawn. Them. Destiny.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: I said...what, is it a cult? They laugh. Destiny does not.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: It is a cult, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But the real problem was...Ramona had absolutely zero business sense.  74.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Look what happened with Victor. Dawn slips too much powder into VICTOR’s (40s) drink.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He was good-looking, had money, not a genius, not a pervert. That's the quadruple-threat right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parked. Ramona on her cell in the driver’s seat, Victor’s card in hand.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: What’s my credit limit again? Fifty thousand? She turns to Destiny. Destiny shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s do it for the full fifty.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: We'll never see him again.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Who cares.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That's the problem with Ramona. I saw the forest. She saw the fifty thousand dollar tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramona scrolls through her phone. Looking frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: She burned through our regulars. Which left us with unpredictable strangers... PRE-LAP, a door-bell...  75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens. Destiny is on the front porch. Mercedes i crying in the doorway, wearing vintage Swimona.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Out back. Mercedes follows Destiny out back to see -- EXT. RICH MAN’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS A NAKED MAN face down on the concrete, unconscious, bleed from his head... a foot away from the pool.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: He said he could dive off the roof and I said he couldn’t. Destiny looks up. Then down.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: .+. you were right. She goes to him and feels for a pulse. Thank God.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where's Georgia?

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: She took off.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Where the fuck’s Ramona? This is her client...

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: I couldn’t get a hold of her.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Goddamn it. Alright, get his legs.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Is he dead?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Not yet.  76.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: (crying harder) We’re not gonna kill him, are we?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: No! We're gonna take him to the hospital. Help me get him... Destiny and Mercedes peel him off the ground. EXT. RICH MAN’S HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER They carry the bleeding man toward Destiny's Escalade and see Annabelle in the passenger seat. She turns to see the

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Oh no no no no...

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Get the door. Annabelle climbs out, opens the back door, throws up.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Call Ramona. And don’t stop until you reach her. Destiny and Mercedes fold his body into the back-seat. INT. DESTINY’S ESCALADE - LATER Destiny drives, Annabelle beside her, covering her mouth. Mercedes is in back, the naked man leaning against her, unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Has she texted back? Annabelle shakes her head, trying not to vomit. Mercedes a COP CAR at the next light.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Slow down... Destiny sees it too. Slows down. Just then, the naked man opens his eyes. He turns to Mercedes.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ--  77. Annabelle turns to see him and starts screaming. Mercedes jumps, startled, accidentally elbowing the man in the fac He’s out cold again. The three women look straight ahead. Waiting for the ligh change. We don’t see the cop’s faces. It takes too long. Finally, a green light. The cop car pulls ahead. Destiny slowly hits the gas. Annabelle throws up on herself. INT. DESTINY’S ESCALADE - LATER They pull up to the EMERGENCY DROP-OFF at the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Where are we gonna put him?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: We’re gonna take him inside.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: I thought we were gonna leave him.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: We can’t leave him.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: I’m not going inside.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Mercedes, this is a business... Mercedes opens the car door and runs away in her bathing suit.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mercedes! Destiny calls after, but Mercedes’s bare feet are gone. Destiny turns to Annabelle in the passenger seat. Useless Destiny hops out of the car and goes around back, draggin the unconscious, naked man out. A SECURITY GUARD sees her calls for the MEDICS who come running out to help. Destin fake-sobs.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My husband... my husband... The medics take over as she wails. She looks at Annabelle slumped over. Then, reluctantly helps Annabelle out of th car.  78.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My sister... my sister...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny paces outside, covered in blood, cell phone to he ear. The sound of ringing. Then:

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Hi this is Ramona...please leave your name and number and where we met and I'll get right back to you.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Bitch! INT. DESTINY’S ESCALADE - MORNING Destiny tears into the driveway, screeches to a stop. She runs out of the car, engine running, races out, still in night’s clothes, and inside -- INT. DESTINY’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS She bursts through the door.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Lily? Lily? She hurries through the house. Her daughter’s room is emp

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: She runs back down the hall to the kitchen where she find NOTE. She races out of the house to -- EXT. DESTINY’S NEIGHBOR'S HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER Destiny bangs on the door. A WELL-DRESSED WOMAN (30s) ans the door holding Lily.

dialogues.speaker: WELL-DRESSED WOMAN
dialogues.text: There’s Mommy...

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: You’re late.  79.
