dialogues.speaker: WELL-DRESSED WOMAN
dialogues.text: The baby-sitter said she had to go home but we had ourselves a fun sleepover, didn’t we?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Yeah! Destiny reaches out for Lily, hurriedly taking her in her arms. The woman looks at Destiny’s clothes, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Yeah, thanks, c’mon, Lily.

dialogues.speaker: WELL-DRESSED WOMAN
dialogues.text: .«.. do you want me to take her?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: I got her, Amy, thanks. Destiny rushes off in her heels with Lily. INT. DESTINY’S ESCALADE - LATER Destiny pulls up at the school drop-off, gets out of the and suddenly realizes what she looks like. She opens the door, helps Lily out of her car-seat.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Aren’t you gonna walk me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny holds Lily’s hand as they quickly make their way to the school. A few other PARENTS look at Destiny. Her f inch heels. Last night’s clothes.

dialogues.speaker: PARENT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Is that blood? The walk seems to take forever. They finally reach the do

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Okay have a good day... Destiny leads Lily inside, then turns and walks all the w back to her car, everyone watching, the sound of her heel

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Where was Ramona when I needed her?  80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramona is bailing Dawn out of jail. INT. DESTINY’S ESCALADE - LATER In the school lot, Destiny gets in her parked car, covere blood. She looks down to see her cell ringing, RAMONA. Destiny answers, furious tears in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Don’t ever call me again.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (THROUGH PHONE)
dialogues.text: Baby... Destiny hangs up. And starts her car. EXT. DESTINY’S GRANDMOTHER'S HOUSE - LATER Destiny pulls her Escalade in front. She shuffles up the steps. Opens the front door. INT. DESTINY’S GRANDMOTHER’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS Destiny walks in to see her grandmother sitting in her ch Destiny stops. She knows immediately that her grandmother dead. Destiny braces herself in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny buries her grandmother, her daughter sitting next her. The PRIEST is speaking when SOMEONE walks up and tak the empty seat next to Destiny. Destiny looks over to see RAMONA. Wearing black. She reaches out for Destiny’s hand Destiny leans into her, tears rolling down her face. Ramo puts her arm around her, their heads on top of each other

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I wasn’t there, baby. Destiny sobs in Ramona’s arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juliet and Lily run around in the grass. Ramona and Desti are still sitting in the same spot.  81.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: I don’t want to go home.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Do you and Lily wanna stay with us? Destiny slowly nods yes.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m supposed to meet someone. If you want to join me. Destiny knows what this means.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take your mind off things. (then) No pressure. (then) But if you need the money... We HOLD on them for awhile.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I knew it had to stop...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. DESTINY’S HOUSE - DAY The interview continues.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: I kept thinking there was this magic number, that if I could save enough money, I could start clean. Me and Lily. Maybe a score so big, we wouldn’t need anybody.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Is that what happened with Doug

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny looks up at Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Uh... I don’t remember a Doug [BLEEP].

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Ramona said...  82.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Well, she’s a liar. She’ll say anything to make herself sound better. What’d she say about me? I’m sure she had a lot to say. What did she tell you? Elizabeth looks at her. Takes a long pause. Proceeds slow

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: She said you had a tough time growing up. That you spent a lot of time alone. That you got in fights and...had some bad boyfriends.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: What else.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: She said your parents were immigrants. And that after your father left, your mother dropped you off at your grandparents... Destiny gets lost in the memory.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH TO
dialogues.text: EXT. DESTINY’S GRANDMOTHER'S HOUSE - 1989 MOM’S CAR DRIVES AWAY FROM US AND DISAPPEARS OVER THE HIL

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: ++. and never came back. Destiny stares off.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is that true? Destiny nods yes, still lost in the thought.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: I thought maybe she was taking a break...that maybe moms just needed a break. The tears fall, but Destiny wipes them away.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why would she tell you all that?  83.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: I think she wanted me to understand that...for you it wasn’t about revenge. You were just trying to make friends. Destiny can’t look at Elizabeth. The tears keep falling.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Destiny. I know I’m supposed to think that what you did is terrible and that these men didn’t deserve it, but...the truth is...I don’t feel that sorry for them. Destiny wipes her tears away. Nods her head.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: I feel sorry for them. (then) I keep having this nightmare. Where I’m in the back-seat of a moving car...and then I realize that nobody's driving the car...and like I have to climb in the front seat and try to get hold of the wheel but like...I can’t get a grip on it and I can’t stop it no matter what and...then I wake up. Destiny looks up at Elizabeth. Then reaches out and pushe STOP on the recorder. The sound DROPS OUT... But it’s clear that Destiny is ending the interview. She Elizabeth to leave. Escorts her to the front door. Elizabeth walks out. The d shuts on her. We STAY with Elizabeth. INT. ELIZABETH’S HOUSE - LATER No sound, as Elizabeth shuffles through the door, exhaust She flops on the couch. A beat, then she stirs, reacting something. She reaches for her bag. Pulls out her cell. DESTINY CALLING. Elizabeth answers. THE SOUND RETURNS. Destiny’s V.O. is now over the phone.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (THROUGH PHONE)
dialogues.text: Ramona met Doug years ago...  84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramona, in her stripping days, gives comfort and advice t PALE MAN (30s) who is sitting at the bar, hunched over.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: His friend took him to the club to blow off some steam after a few devastating events that included...

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: His house being leveled by a hurricane...

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: «+. and separating from the mother of his young son. DOUG and his LAWYER sit across from his WIFE and HER LAWY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny and Dawn are sitting at a table with Doug. Dawn i sneaking coke, leaving Destiny and Doug in conversation.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: She never really wanted to have kids, you know? So...when we found out he was autistic, I think she just couldn’t handle it, you know? Destiny looks at him, sympathetically.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We talked about our kids. We talked about our exes. We had a heart to--

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Drinks! Ramona returns with their drinks. Doug takes his drink.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Oh thank you.  85. Destiny watches Doug take a big sip. Her hand almost reac out to stop him, but... he swallows.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And then what happened? THE ROOM GOES QUIET.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Destiny? Destiny?? CLOSE on Destiny’s guilt-ridden face, as we...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. DOUG’S SMALL KITCHEN - DAY Doug now sits across from Elizabeth. Recorder on the tabl

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: The room was...round?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: There was a...table?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: I couldn't feel my face. Elizabeth looks at Doug. He can’t even make eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny is on her cell, Doug’s voice in her ear, crying.  86.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG, (THROUGH THE PHONE)
dialogues.text: Can you please just credit back my debit card? My mortgage payment is on there... Destiny tries to stay strong.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? You had a good time.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this to me? (she can’t respond) Please I have nothing. I can’t afford to not pay my mortgage. (she can’t respond) My son.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: (almost inaudible) --. I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Hang up the phone, Destiny. We see Ramona sitting nearby. Destiny doesn’t hang up. Ra bursts from her chair then goes for the phone, trying to it out of Destiny’s hand. The two of them fall to the gro As they roll around, Ramona grabbing at the phone...

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If we. Don’t. Do it. Somebody. Else. Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug talks to Elizabeth...

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: They maxed out my corporate card. So my company launched an internal investigation and I was fired. NOW, DESTINY SITS IN ELIZABETH’s PLACE. FACE-TO-FACE WITH DOUG.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When I finally got a new job, I was told that my name had been reported to an agency that tracks white- collar crime and I was fired again.  87. Chopin's Etude Op. 25, No. 11...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny sits in the back-seat, looking out the window at city passing by. Her eyes are tired, worried, her mind racing. She turns ahead. And we are now in -- INT. DAISY’S MOM’S CAR - DAY NOBODY IS DRIVING THE CAR. WE ARE IN HER NIGHTMARE. Desti panics. She climbs into the front seat, her body heavy. S grabs the wheel, trying to turn it, but it doesn’t work. brake won’t work. As Destiny starts to scream, we....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DETECTIVE (40s) sits at his desk blotting two slices of pizza on paper plates. His phone rings. He keeps blotting slices for awhile, then fumbles with the oily napkins, sh them off into the trash can by his feet. He finally answe

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Precinct.

dialogues.text: Yes hello I... I went to a strip club and I was drugged and my credit card was ran up. The detective hangs up. Then picks up the pizza and takes bite. After a moment, his phone rings again. He answers.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Precinct.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG, (THROUGH THE PHONE)
dialogues.text: I was drugged and I have proof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth interviews the DETECTIVE and ANOTHER DETECTIVE (50s).

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: It was weird.  88.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: It was real weird. If it wasn’t for the tape I woulda been like “Dude you're fucking full of shit.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on a TAPE RECORDER playing. Doug sits with members the DEA TACTICAL-DIVERSION SQUAD, listening to the sound Doug’s recorded tears. DOUG’S VOICE (ON TAPE) Please. I just want to know what happened to me. Recorded Doug sobs. One of the officers stifles a laugh. DAWN’S VOICE (ON TAPE) You were fleeced, that’s all. DOUG’S VOICE (ON TAPE) By who? DAWN’S VOICE (ON TAPE) We're like a little gang. You were just a target. We just gave you a sprinkle. THE SCENE FREEZES.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: They never said who it was but I fucking know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dawn is dropped in the seat, hands in cuffs. Immediately:

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: I‘1l tell you everything. What do you want to know? Please I don’t want to go back. I’1l do anything. THE SCENE FREEZES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dawn opens the door. Destiny and Ramona are in the hallwa AUDIO: The scene is heard through the WIRE-TAP on Dawn's

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: Did you bring the drugs?

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA DESTINY
dialogues.text: Shhhhh... Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: He’s in the bathroom... They walk inside the suite. Looking around.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t think he likes me. I think one of you has to do it.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: (suspicious) Are you high?

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA DAWN
dialogues.text: Give her a break. Me? No! No, I...I don’t do that anymore. Destiny looks at Dawn, even more suspicious. A toilet flushes. A GUY (30s) emerges from the bathroom to see the three of them.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, these are my friends. This is Ramona and--

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Ronda. Dawn looks at Destiny. The guy looks psyched.

dialogues.text: Well, alright...

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: Here why don’t you sit down and we'll fix you a drink? C’mon girls you want to help me? Dawn forces him into a chair. Ramona and Destiny follow D to the kitchenette/mini bar out of view. Destiny takes a out of her purse. Dawn pours a mini scotch into a glass.  90.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alright, now do it. Destiny looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Well, go ‘head. Nobody moves. Dawn looks at them, getting frustrated. She grabs the vile, dumps it in the drink, walks it back to h

dialogues.text: Oh thank you very much. The girls all go back to the living room, sitting around man as he takes a sip.

dialogues.speaker: HOTEL GUY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So...how is this usually done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramona speeds down the FDR. Destiny is panicking beside h looking back.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: I’m telling you it’s the same fucking car.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: You're being paranoid.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: I saw the same fucking Buick parked outside the Gansevoort.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: That’s not a Buick.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Well whatever the fuck it is, it’s been following us for twenty minutes. Can’t you see? Dawn was setting us up back there.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Dawn?? Now I know you’re paranoid.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: You think Dawn wouldn’t sell you out to save herself? Ramona reaches out to her. Destiny smacks her hand away.  91.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So? Was there a sting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The detectives try to keep their poker faces with Elizabe

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: We...cannot comment on that...at this time...but what we can tell you was that the amount of people willing to talk to us was so small it was absurd.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: I guess men don’t want to...admit to what happened to them, you know? To being victimized. By a women. But then we found the architect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The detective buys a newspaper from a VENDOR, about to wa away when he sees the cover of the DAILY NEWS. He picks i and opens it, searching for a section. Finds it, reads it eyes growing wider.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Connecticut architect who Moves said failed to pay a 135 thousand dollar bill he'd racked up during four visits to the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: “For a night of pleasure he can’t even remember...” What a boob. INT. NYC PRECINCT - SARGEANT’S OFFICE - LATER The detectives show the SERGEANT (60s).  92.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: So the guy got drugged and then went back three more times? Guess he must've liked it. They all share a hearty laugh.

dialogues.text: Good. Maybe now he’1l pay his bill. Ramona goes back to filing her nails. Destiny looks at he Ghost white. Terrified. Destiny swallows.

dialogues.text: Hands where we can see ‘em! Ramona has great difficulty opening her fists. She finall does. The money flies out of her hands and down the stree

Annabelle looks up. Then bur from her seat. Grabs her cat. The door is kicked in. Annabelle tries to climb out the fire escape but the COPS grab her. The cat jumps out of her arms. Annabelle throws

She sees Lily in the neighbor's arms, watching her. Destiny tries to look stro

dialogues.text: Destiny joins Ramona, Mercedes and Annabelle. They’re lik different exotic birds chirping in a cage. Annabelle is crying, vomit on her shirt. The detective steps up.

dialogues.text: This is unbelievable. You guys really are something, you know that? Does Tony know about this?

dialogues.text: «+. think about your daughter.

dialogues.text: Mercedes’11 probably use Dragon’s lawyer, so you and me and Annabelle should probably lawyer up. Do we know any lawyers from the club? That guy Jeremy. Or maybe Anton?

dialogues.text: .+-. I took the deal.  96. Ramona stops. Turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: «+. you did? Destiny nods her head, starts to cry. Ramona looks at her And explodes:

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have I taught you fucking nothing? Ramona paces.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You stupid fucking idiot what the fuck is wrong with you? Ramona grabs Destiny by the shoulders and shakes her.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How could you do that??

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: -- Lily. Ramona stops. She looks at Destiny. Ramona clenches her teeth, but her chin starts to tremble. Ramona shakes her head. Then pulls Destiny in by the shoulders. They hug ea other, crying on each other’s shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Motherhood’s a mental illness. Ramona holds Destiny in her arms. They know this is it fo them. This is goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: --. I’m sorry. Ramona shakes her head. She squeezes Destiny tight, angry tears on her cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: «+. we were fucking hurricanes, weren’t we? Ramona pulls away first. Destiny’s arms are still reachin out as Ramona walks away from her.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: It is quiet. Then... a RINGING PHONE takes us to...  97. INT. ELIZABETH’S HOUSE - DAY [2014] Elizabeth, now pregnant, answers her phone. In the background, a BABY SHOWER in progress. It’s a girl.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Elizabeth...it’s Destiny.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Hey, Destiny. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: WITH
dialogues.text: INT. DESTINY’S HOUSE - SAME Destiny sits in her living room. Her voice almost echoes the emptiness. No sound except her jewelry.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Good. Really good. Lily’s good. Um...we’re moving back to Queens. But...I’ve been making a ton of new friends. And I met a man who’s helping me get a job in pharmaceuticals. Are you still there?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: I’m here, Destiny.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: Well, I’ve been thinking about things and...maybe the reason we did what we did? Is cause hurt people hurt people. You know? Elizabeth opens a door to another room.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have you talked to Ramona lately?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: No...just the one time. (then) Have you?

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: No... Destiny looks across the room at her daughter playing.  98.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can I ask you... (then) What else did she say about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramona sits across from Elizabeth, now in the manager's chair. There’s a warmth between them. Ramona has her big open on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: ++. so I was living in the Bronx at the time but I was seeing this guy who had this walk-up right next to where I stripped, so I was staying at his place like every night...and then this one morning, I went back to my place and my front door was wide open and it just freaked me out, you know? That all my stuff, all my valuable stuff was in this place that I wasn’t even sleeping in...so now I just carry everything with me all the time. Ramona opens up her bag and begins a show-and-tell.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This was a patch from my grandpa’s uniform. He was in the Navy. This was my grandma’s wedding band and this was my mother’s, see the three birthstones are me and my sisters. Elizabeth looks at her, endeared.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One lives in Texas, the other one’s in Arizona. We try to get together once a year but it’s impossible with kids. Do you have kids?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Oh don’t worry, you’re young. You have amazing skin. Everyone must tell you that.  99. Elizabeth notices something in the bag.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Is that you? She points at a photo of a YOUNG GIRL. Ramona laughs.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s me. A senior asked me to the prom. Look how terrified. I like my dress though. Ramona pulls another photo out from behind it. LITTLE DESTINY. We recognize her sweet face.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And that’s Dorothy. Wasn’t she the cutest? Who could leave this baby? Ramona gazes lovingly at the photo of Little Destiny.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We used to say...if only we had known each other back then...you know? Maybe we could’ve...been there for each other...and maybe our whole lives would’ve been different, you know? She looks at the two photos side-by-side. Ramona at fifte Destiny at five. Ramona gets em at the thought. Tears in eyes for the first time. She smiles them away.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe it’d be the same. Who knows. I can’t talk to her. But...I still like to carry her with me. Ramona puts her childhood photo face-to-face with Destiny childhood photo and slides them back in their place.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: INT. DESTINY’S HOUSE - DAY Destiny holds the phone to her ear. A tear falls.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY AND RAMONA'S FRIENDSHIP IN REVERSE
dialogues.text: Looking at each other in jail  100. Fighting each other on the floor Holding hands at Grandma’s funeral Dancing with the “family” at Christmas Holding hands at the diner Hugging each other again after the crash Destiny trying on Ramona's bathing suit Ramona helping Destiny with the money in her boot Destiny wrapped in Ramona's fur coat, their heads on top each other.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You should give her a call, Destiny.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN TO
dialogues.text: INT. DESTINY’S HOUSE - DAY Destiny nods, wiping away the tears, and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DESTINY
dialogues.text: «+. yeah.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Destiny pled guilty to conspiracy, grand larceny and attempted assault in exchange for zero jail time.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO
dialogues.text: Ramona served five years probation.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Mercedes and Annabelle were sentenced to weekends in pris and are now on five years’ probation.  101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world turns. Another night in the club, the floor pac with men paying to watch the women dance. As we witness t exchange, we hear a familiar voice...

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There's really nothing I can say to make sense of what went down. But everybody's hustling... INT. RAMONA’S OFFICE - THE DAY OF HER INTERVIEW Ramona looks just past us.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA
dialogues.text: This city, this whole country is a strip club. You got people tossing the money. And people doing the dance.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: CUE: Janet Jackson's “Miss You Much”...

dialogues.speaker: DJ'S VOICE
dialogues.text: One last time everybody, let's hear it for our girls! INT. RAMONA’S APARTMENT - FLASHBACK The night of their first big score. Destiny, Ramona, Mercedes, and Annabelle are celebrating together. Janet i playing. They’re lined up in the living room.
The four girls do choreographed moves together, laughing, cracking up, dancing with each other, dancing for themsel
